column4: hi, I have a problem with writing partition table to a 160Gb seagate disk, fdisk seemsto work fine, though no partition table is created
Ihe found this thread http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-91538.html , but no solution there
anyone have dealt with this problem before?
You tried only fdisk?
parted cfdisk qtparted
and different machines with or withoud a raid controller
Then have you tried Windows installed in that hdd?
no but my friends PC (with XP) seems to deal with it just fine
can partition it etc.
You should first check the jumper on your hdd.
tried master/slave/cable select...
you've tried that?
yes, Its like the drive is ignoring linux :)
So you even put the drive into different machines, but no help, right?
no help at all

I've read about someone had a st hdd, and he found it was noising, but never did he know why until one day he found his hdd was working under sata1 capable mode... There should be another jumper if the hdd is a sata2 one.
it is an ata 100
it's quite an old one...
use command "dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sda" to write zeros to your disk. and use gparted to build the partition table again.
http://www.seagate.com/ww/v/index.jsp?vgnextoid=eb8b9be7238b0110VgnVCM100000f5ee0a0aRCRD&locale=en-US
if it wont work ill try the limited capacity
be careful to use that command, you will lose all your data
i know dd, I used it to backup partitions
